job_title: THL Care Manager in Morrison, TN
pros: Medium case load, Great co workers
cons: Terrible communication, Weird pay day schedule

pros: The clients are the reason I stayed as long as I did.
cons: The staff doesn't care about you at all. They work you to death if you let them.

review_title: They do not care about their employees
pros: Pay was decent, but that’s the only good thing I can say
cons: I worked a shift and informed my supervisor earlier in the week that my stepfather was in the hospital and I might need to leave at a moments notice. She told me it was fine and to keep her informed. I got the phone call that he was dying and I needed to get there ASAP and I called her, who told me she was busy and I would have to work the rest of my shift. He died an hour before my shift ended and I wasn’t allowed to leave to be with my family until I got off work.

pros: Working with the patients teaches me a lot and how to deal with the real world on a daily basis.
cons: The pay sucks for what we deal with at Magnolia McKenzie Campus, they don't give their 90 day raises on time like they're supposed to.. They don't listen to anything you try to tell them about patients. Its all about the company getting a check from our patients.

job_title: Psychiatric Technicians/Certified Nursing Assistant in McKenzie, TN
pros: The Pay is great for such an easy job.
cons: The things you put up with and some of the workers you work with keep drama going. Its like working with high school students

job_title: Social Services Director in Spencer, TN
pros:
Interaction with residents 
Understanding about time off
cons:
Benefits are not good. 
Management is disrespectful and not appreciative of staff.  Administrator does not back up employees. Morale is horrible and staffing is very low due to turnover because of management.

pros: Enjoyed talking with pts about things they used to do and wanted to do when they got to go home,,playing games with pts,morning walks,working with other caregivers that believed in team work and just interacting with pts
cons: working alone at night with some times pts that would threatin my life,not allowed to call 911 for nothing!! Expected to prep all meals when day shift had 5 workers and evening shift had 3 to 4

pros: Loving working with my srs they are the best.
cons: Pay sucks no raise no  appreciation no overtime insurance  is way to high. Need a whole new management team.

pros: There are no pros about this company
cons: I was fired simply because I knew too much
